summary: Hermione does not appear directly in this chapter, but she is referenced through a birthday gift she sends to Harry. Her present—a new homework planner—arrives via owl post and reflects her characteristic mix of thoughtfulness and academic rigor. The gift comes with a note advising him to “do your homework!”—a message that blends care with her usual disciplined tone. Even from a distance, Hermione is trying to keep Harry on track and offer support in her own logic-driven way.
logline: Hermione’s birthday gift reminds Harry—and readers—of her persistent, loving commitment to order and responsibility.
speech_style: (in note) Encouraging but stern; emphasizes discipline through affection
emotional_state: Distant but supportive; Hermione’s intent comes through the gift
